instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2849: What is 820-2849? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> headphone jack
threads.message:
Hi.

Board does not detect internal audio. Shoved the stem of an ear bud in there and it detects audio.
In a absence of a replacement jack, is there a line I can cut or short to enable internal audio permanently?

... Connect pin 2 and pin 1 of J6700?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> headphone jack
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> headphone jack
threads.message:
Thanks Duke.
I tried searching for the jacks to buy in but I'm not finding anything. Any suggestions?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> headphone jack
threads.message: Scrap boards of course. Jacks are the same on 13"

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> headphone jack
threads.message:
All the jacks on 15.4" and 13.3" are all the same size but not the same as the 17" matte screen. The 17" MacBook Pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board's jacks are slightly longer.
I looked through every board in the pile to find the right size and came up short.

Turns out that it just needed a UC. Dirty contact or something.

Please mark as solved. Thank you for your help.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> headphone jack
threads.message: Oh yeah the 17" are indeed different.
